summary: the study was funded by the Canadian Institutes of Health Research. 78% of the 67,000 residents they investigated received at least 1 course of antibiotics that year. 45% of the treatments lasted more than 7 days, the study said. an estimated 1 in 10 Canadians have some form of liver disease. up to 25% of Canadians are affected by fatty liver disease linked to obesity. the largest increases in liver disease are occurring in Ontario, Quebec, Alberta and British Columbia. provincial health officer for the western-most province says public health officials are monitoring bird flu situation in China. the level of risk from the new bird flu strain is currently considered low. the new strain causing illness in China has not been identified in birds in Canada. NCoV first appeared in the middle east in the fall of 2012.
